Summary: WHISLIST
Functional Requirements
Data Requirements
FR01: The system should store user profiles, including name, email, and role (student/instructor/admin).
FR02: Course materials (Lecture Notes, quizzes,Assignments) should be uploaded, stored, and retrieved by students.
FR03: Student progress, grades, and attendance should be automatically updated after completing quizzes, assignments, or attending classes.
FR04: The system should allow instructors to export reports on student performance in CSV/PDF formats.
FR05: Students should be able to enroll in and drop courses dynamically.
Interface Requirements
FR06: The LMS should have a dashboard for students, instructors, and admins with relevant stats.
FR07: The interface should support dark mode and light mode for better user experience.
FR08: Course content should be displayed in a structured format with a navigation bar.
FR09: The system should provide a search bar to allow users to quickly find courses, materials, or discussions.
FR09: Users should be able to customize their profiles, including profile pictures and bios.
FR11: Students should be able to set learning goals and receive progress reminders.
Personalization Requirements
FR10: Users should be able to customize their profiles, including profile pictures and bios.
FR11: The system should recommend courses based on past enrollments and require students to repeat any failed subjects.
FR12: Students should be able to set learning goals and receive progress reminders.
FR13: Users should be able to customize notification settings (email, SMS, or in-app alerts).
Transactional Requirements
FR14: Instructors should be able to create, update, and delete courses.
FR15: The system should support secure payments for premium courses using cash or credit/debit cards.
FR16: A feedback system should allow students to rate courses and provide reviews after completion.
FR17: Instructors should be able to manually mark student attendance for each class session, and the system should store and update attendance records in real time.
Quality Requirements
NFR01: The system should be able to handle at least 500 concurrent users without any lag.
NFR02: Page load time should not exceed 2 seconds under normal conditions.
NFR03: The system should be available and operational 99.9% of the time, ensuring minimal downtime.
NFR04: Data should be encrypted using AES-256 to ensure security of user information.
NFR05: Add a privacy policy page explaining how data is stored and used.
Project Constraints
NFR06: The LMS must be developed and deployed within 6 months.
NFR07: The system must comply with GDPR(General Data Protection Regulation) and FERPA (Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act) regulations for data privacy.
NFR08: The LMS should be accessible on both mobile and desktop devices.
NFR09: The system must be implemented using a scalable cloud-based architecture to support future growth.
